meanings.sent1: After the king lost his crown, the royal jeweler had to recrowning him.
meanings.sent2: The dentist had to recrowning the tooth that had a cavity.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally dropped the cake, so he had to recrowning it with fresh icing.
meanings.sent4: The sun recrowning the mountain peaks with golden light at dawn.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully recrowning the statue with a new layer of gold paint.

meanings.sent1: The recrowning of the champion was a grand ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The recrowning of the statue was necessary after it was damaged in the storm.
meanings.sent3: The recrowning of the cake with extra frosting made it look even more delicious.
meanings.sent4: The recrowning of the hill with fresh flowers brought joy to the villagers.
meanings.sent5: The recrowning of the tree with new leaves signaled the arrival of spring.
